SOS media anthropology -lrb- also known as anthropology of media or mass media -rrb- emphasizes ethnographic studies as a means of understanding producers , audiences , and other cultural and social aspects of mass media . EOS
SOS the types of ethnographic contexts explored range from contexts of media production -lrb- e.g . , ethnographies of newsrooms in newspapers , journalists in the field , film production -rrb- to contexts of media reception , following audiences in their everyday responses to media . EOS
SOS this is in addition to many classic ethnographic contexts , where media such as radio , the press , new media and television have started to make their UNK felt since the early 1990s . EOS
SOS the types of ethnographic contexts explored range from contexts of media production -lrb- e.g . , ethnographies of newsrooms in newspapers , journalists in the field , film production -rrb- to contexts of media reception , following audiences in their everyday responses to media . EOS
SOS other types include cyber anthropology , a relatively new area of internet research , as well as ethnographies of other areas of research which happen to involve media , such as development work , social movements , or health education . EOS
SOS visual anthropology is concerned , in part , with the study and production of ethnographic photography , film and , since the mid-1990s , new media . EOS
SOS while the term is sometimes used interchangeably with ethnographic film , visual anthropology also encompasses the anthropological study of visual representation , including areas such as performance , museums , art , and the production and reception of mass media . EOS

SOS cognitive anthropology seeks to explain patterns of shared knowledge , cultural innovation , and transmission over time and space using the methods and theories of the cognitive sciences -lrb- especially experimental psychology and evolutionary biology -rrb- often through close collaboration with historians , ethnographers , archaeologists , linguists , musicologists and other specialists engaged in the description and interpretation of cultural forms . SOS portugal is defined as a mediterranean climate -lrb- csa in the south , interior , and douro region ; csb in the north , central portugal and coastal alentejo ; mixed oceanic climate along the northern half of the coastline and also semi-arid climate or steppe climate -lrb- bsk in certain parts of beja district far south -rrb- according to the kppen-geiger climate classification -rrb- , and is one of the warmest european countries : the annual average temperature in mainland portugal varies from 8 -- 12 c -lrb- 46.4 -- 53.6 f -rrb- in the mountainous interior north to 16 -- 19 c -lrb- 60.8 -- 66.2 f -rrb- in the south and on the guadiana river basin . SOS while possession is legal , trafficking and possession of more than " 10 days worth of personal use " are still punishable by jail time and fines . EOS
SOS people caught with small amounts of any drug are given the choice to go to a UNK facility , and may refuse treatment without consequences . EOS
SOS despite criticism from other european nations , who stated portugal 's drug consumption would UNK increase , overall drug use has declined along with the number of hiv infection cases , which had dropped 50 percent by 2009 . EOS

SOS continental portugal is UNK into 18 districts , while the archipelagos of the azores and madeira are governed as autonomous regions ; the largest units , established since 1976 , are either mainland portugal -lrb- portuguese : portugal continental -rrb- and the autonomous regions of portugal -lrb- azores and madeira -rrb- . SOS the armed forces have three branches : navy , army and air force . EOS
SOS the armed forces have three branches : navy , army and air force . EOS
SOS as of 2008 , the three branches numbered UNK active personnel including 7,500 women . EOS
SOS portuguese military expenditure in 2009 was $ 5.2 billion , representing 2.1 percent of gdp . EOS
SOS the army -lrb- 21,000 personnel -rrb- comprises three brigades and other small units . EOS
SOS an infantry brigade -lrb- mainly equipped with pandur ii apc -rrb- , a mechanized brigade -lrb- mainly equipped with leopard 2 a6 tanks and m113 apc -rrb- and a rapid reaction brigade -lrb- consisting of paratroopers , commandos and rangers -rrb- . EOS

SOS in the 20th century , portugal engaged in two major conflicts : world war i and the portuguese colonial war -lrb- 1961 -- 1974 -rrb- . EOS
SOS in the 20th century , portugal engaged in two major conflicts : world war i and the portuguese colonial war -lrb- 1961 -- 1974 -rrb- . EOS
SOS after the end of the portuguese empire in 1975 , the portuguese armed forces have participated in peacekeeping missions in east timor , bosnia , kosovo , afghanistan , somalia , iraq -lrb- UNK -rrb- and lebanon . EOS
SOS portugal also conducted several independent unilateral military operations abroad , as were the cases of the interventions of the portuguese armed forces in angola in 1992 and in guinea-bissau in 1998 with the main objectives of protecting and withdrawing of portuguese and foreign citizens threatened by local civil conflicts . SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- after the turmoil of the 1974 revolution and the prec period , portugal tried to adapt to a changing modern global economy , a process that continues in 2013 . EOS
SOS since the 1990s , portugal 's public UNK economic development model has been slowly changing to a system that is focused on exports , private investment and the development of the high-tech sector . EOS

SOS by the early 1970s portugal 's fast economic growth with increasing consumption and purchase of new automobiles set the priority for improvements in transportation . EOS
SOS again in the 1990s , after joining the european economic community , the country built many new motorways . EOS
SOS today , the country has a UNK km -lrb- UNK mi -rrb- road network , of which almost 3,000 km -lrb- UNK mi -rrb- are part of system of 44 motorways . EOS
SOS opened in 1944 , the first motorway -lrb- which linked lisbon to the national stadium -rrb- was an innovative project that made portugal among one of the first countries in the world to establish a motorway -lrb- this roadway eventually became the UNK highway , or a5 -rrb- . EOS

SOS portugal has considerable resources of wind and river power , the two most cost-effective renewable sources . EOS
SOS in 2006 , the world 's largest solar power plant at that date , the moura photovoltaic power station , began operating near moura , in the south , while the world 's first commercial wave power farm , the UNK wave farm , opened in the norte region -lrb- 2008 -rrb- . EOS
SOS in 2006 , the world 's largest solar power plant at that date , the moura photovoltaic power station , began operating near moura , in the south , while the world 's first commercial wave power farm , the UNK wave farm , opened in the norte region -lrb- 2008 -rrb- . EOS
SOS by the end of 2006 , 66 % of the country 's electrical production was from coal and fuel power plants , while 29 % were derived from hydroelectric dams , and 6 % by wind energy . EOS
SOS portugal 's national energy transmission company , UNK UNK UNK -lrb- ren -rrb- , uses sophisticated modeling to predict weather , especially wind patterns , and computer programs to calculate energy from the various UNK plants . EOS
SOS portugal 's national energy transmission company , UNK UNK UNK -lrb- ren -rrb- , uses sophisticated modeling to predict weather , especially wind patterns , and computer programs to calculate energy from the various UNK plants . EOS
SOS before the UNK revolution , portugal had generated electricity from hydropower plants on its rivers for decades . EOS
SOS new programs combine wind and water : UNK turbines pump water UNK at night , the most UNK period ; then the water flows downhill by day , generating electricity , when consumer demand is highest . EOS
SOS the government aggressively encouraged such contributions by setting a premium price for those who buy UNK solar electricity . EOS

SOS this population has been relatively homogeneous for most of its history : a single religion -lrb- catholicism -rrb- and a single language have contributed to this ethnic and national unity , namely after the expulsion of the moors and jews . EOS
SOS a considerable number of moors and jews , nevertheless , stayed in portugal , under the condition that they converted to catholicism , and afterwards they were known as UNK -lrb- former muslims -rrb- and UNK UNK -lrb- new christians or former jews -rrb- some of whom may have continued to observe rabbinic judaism in secret , as in the case of the secret jews of UNK , who now observe the jewish faith openly . SOS the most important demographic influence in the modern portuguese seems to be the oldest one ; current interpretation of y-chromosome and mtdna data suggests that the portuguese have their origin in paleolithic peoples that began arriving to the european continent around 45,000 years ago . EOS
SOS the most important demographic influence in the modern portuguese seems to be the oldest one ; current interpretation of y-chromosome and mtdna data suggests that the portuguese have their origin in paleolithic peoples that began arriving to the european continent around 45,000 years ago . EOS
SOS all subsequent migrations did leave an impact , genetically and culturally , but the main population source of the portuguese is still paleolithic . EOS
SOS portugal 's colonial history has long since been a cornerstone of its national identity , as has its geographic position at the south-western corner of europe , looking out into the atlantic ocean . EOS
SOS portugal 's colonial history has long since been a cornerstone of its national identity , as has its geographic position at the south-western corner of europe , looking out into the atlantic ocean . EOS
SOS it was one of the last western colonial european powers to give up its overseas territories -lrb- among them angola and mozambique in 1975 -rrb- , turning over the administration of macau to the people 's republic of china at the end of 1999 . EOS
SOS portugal , long a country of emigration -lrb- the vast majority of brazilians have portuguese ancestry -rrb- , has now become a country of net immigration , and not just from the last indian -lrb- portuguese until 1961 -rrb- , african -lrb- portuguese until 1975 -rrb- , and far east asian -lrb- portuguese until 1999 -rrb- overseas territories . SOS two major extant branches of buddhism are generally recognized by scholars : theravada -lrb- " the school of the elders " -rrb- and mahayana -lrb- " the great vehicle " -rrb- . EOS
SOS vajrayana , a body of teachings attributed to indian siddhas , may be viewed as a third branch or merely a part of mahayana . EOS
SOS theravada has a widespread following in sri lanka and southeast asia . EOS
SOS mahayana which includes the traditions of pure land , zen , nichiren buddhism , shingon , and UNK -lrb- tendai -rrb- is found throughout east asia . EOS
SOS buddhists number between an estimated 488 million -lsb- web 1 -rsb- and 535 million , making it one of the world 's major religions . EOS

SOS vajrayana , a body of teachings attributed to indian siddhas , may be viewed as a third branch or merely a part of mahayana . EOS
SOS two major extant branches of buddhism are generally recognized by scholars : theravada -lrb- " the school of the elders " -rrb- and mahayana -lrb- " the great vehicle " -rrb- . EOS
SOS in theravada buddhism , the ultimate goal is the attainment of the sublime state of nirvana , achieved by practicing the noble eightfold path -lrb- also known as the middle way -rrb- , thus escaping what is seen as a cycle of suffering and rebirth . EOS
SOS in theravada buddhism , the ultimate goal is the attainment of the sublime state of nirvana , achieved by practicing the noble eightfold path -lrb- also known as the middle way -rrb- , thus escaping what is seen as a cycle of suffering and rebirth . EOS
SOS mahayana buddhism instead aspires to buddhahood via the bodhisattva path , a state wherein one remains in this cycle to help other beings reach awakening . EOS
SOS tibetan buddhism aspires to buddhahood or rainbow body . EOS
SOS in theravada buddhism , the ultimate goal is the attainment of the sublime state of nirvana , achieved by practicing the noble eightfold path -lrb- also known as the middle way -rrb- , thus escaping what is seen as a cycle of suffering and rebirth . EOS

SOS mahayana buddhism instead aspires to buddhahood via the bodhisattva path , a state wherein one remains in this cycle to help other beings reach awakening . EOS

SOS upon development of samdhi , one 's mind becomes purified of UNK , calm , UNK , and luminous . EOS
SOS once the meditator achieves a strong and powerful concentration -lrb- jhna , sanskrit dhyna -rrb- , his mind is ready to penetrate and gain insight -lrb- vipassan -rrb- into the ultimate nature of reality , eventually obtaining release from all suffering . EOS

SOS samatha meditation starts from being mindful of an object or idea , which is expanded to one 's body , mind and entire surroundings , leading to a state of total concentration and UNK -lrb- jhna -rrb- . EOS
SOS samatha meditation starts from being mindful of an object or idea , which is expanded to one 's body , mind and entire surroundings , leading to a state of total concentration and UNK -lrb- jhna -rrb- . EOS
SOS in buddhist practice , it is said that while samatha meditation can calm the mind , only vipassan meditation can reveal how the mind was disturbed to start with , which is what leads to insight knowledge -lrb- jna ; pli a -rrb- and understanding -lrb- praj pli pa -rrb- , and thus can lead to nirva -lrb- pli nibbna -rrb- . SOS in theravda buddhism , the cause of human existence and suffering is identified as craving , which carries with it the various UNK . EOS
SOS these are believed deeply rooted afflictions of the mind that create suffering and stress . EOS
SOS praj -lrb- sanskrit -rrb- or pa -lrb- pli -rrb- means wisdom that is based on a realization of dependent origination , the four noble truths and the three marks of existence . EOS
SOS praj is the wisdom that is able to extinguish afflictions and bring about bodhi . EOS
SOS initially , praj is attained at a conceptual level by means of listening to sermons -lrb- dharma talks -rrb- , reading , studying , and sometimes reciting buddhist texts and engaging in discourse . EOS
SOS notably , one could in theory attain nirvana at any point of practice , whether deep in meditation , listening to a sermon , conducting the business of one 's daily life , or any other activity . EOS
SOS once the conceptual understanding is attained , it is applied to daily life so that each buddhist can verify the truth of the buddha 's teaching at a practical level . EOS
SOS zen buddhism -lrb- -rrb- , pronounced chn in chinese , seon in korean or zen in japanese -lrb- derived from the sanskrit term dhyna , meaning " meditation " -rrb- is a form of buddhism that became popular in china , korea and japan and that lays special emphasis on meditation . EOS
SOS zen buddhism -lrb- -rrb- , pronounced chn in chinese , seon in korean or zen in japanese -lrb- derived from the sanskrit term dhyna , meaning " meditation " -rrb- is a form of buddhism that became popular in china , korea and japan and that lays special emphasis on meditation . EOS
SOS zen buddhism -lrb- -rrb- , pronounced chn in chinese , seon in korean or zen in japanese -lrb- derived from the sanskrit term dhyna , meaning " meditation " -rrb- is a form of buddhism that became popular in china , korea and japan and that lays special emphasis on meditation . EOS
SOS -lsb- note 12 -rsb- zen places less emphasis on scriptures than some other forms of buddhism and prefers to focus on direct spiritual breakthroughs to truth . EOS
SOS zen buddhism is divided into two main schools : UNK -lrb- -rrb- and st -lrb- -rrb- , the former greatly favouring the use in meditation on the UNK -lrb- , a meditative riddle or puzzle -rrb- as a device for spiritual break-through , and the latter -lrb- while certainly employing UNK -rrb- focusing more on UNK or " just sitting " . EOS

SOS zen buddhist teaching is often full of paradox , in order to loosen the grip of the ego and to facilitate the penetration into the realm of the true self or formless self , which is equated with the buddha himself . EOS

SOS historically , the roots of buddhism lie in the religious thought of ancient india during the second half of the first millennium bce . EOS
SOS -lsb- note 17 -rsb- scholars have reasons to believe that ideas such as samsara , karma -lrb- in the sense of the influence of morality on rebirth -rrb- , and moksha originated in the shramanas , and were later adopted by UNK orthodoxy . EOS
SOS -lsb- note 16 -rsb- these groups , whose members were known as shramanas , were a continuation of a non-vedic strand of indian thought distinct from indo-aryan brahmanism . EOS
SOS -lsb- note 16 -rsb- these groups , whose members were known as shramanas , were a continuation of a non-vedic strand of indian thought distinct from indo-aryan brahmanism . EOS
SOS buddhism arose in greater magadha , which stretched from UNK , the capital of kosala in the north-west , to UNK in the south east . EOS
SOS buddhism arose in greater magadha , which stretched from UNK , the capital of kosala in the north-west , to UNK in the south east . EOS
SOS -lsb- page needed -rsb- it was not until the 2nd or 3rd centuries bce that the eastward spread of brahmanism into greater magadha became significant . EOS
SOS at the same time , these movements were influenced by , and in some respects continued , philosophical thought within the vedic tradition as reflected e.g . in the upanishads . EOS
SOS these movements included , besides buddhism , various skeptics -lrb- such as sanjaya belatthiputta -rrb- , atomists -lrb- such as pakudha kaccayana -rrb- , materialists -lrb- such as ajita kesakambali -rrb- , antinomians -lrb- such as purana kassapa -rrb- ; the most important ones in the 5th century bce were the ajivikas , who emphasized the rule of fate , the lokayata -lrb- materialists -rrb- , the ajnanas -lrb- agnostics -rrb- and the jains , who stressed that the soul must be freed from matter . SOS a particular criticism of the buddha was vedic animal sacrifice . EOS
SOS -lsb- web 18 -rsb- he also mocked the vedic " hymn of the cosmic man " . EOS
SOS he names the vedic rishis , and declared that the original UNK of the rishis -lsb- note 25 -rsb- was altered by a few brahmins who introduced animal sacrifices . EOS
SOS the buddha says that it was on this alteration of the true UNK that he refused to pay respect to the vedas of his time . EOS

SOS a core problem in the study of early buddhism is the relation between UNK and insight . EOS

SOS pre-sectarian buddhism is the earliest phase of buddhism , recognized by nearly all scholars . EOS
SOS certain basic teachings appear in many places throughout the early texts , so most scholars conclude that gautama buddha must have taught something similar to the three marks of existence , the five aggregates , dependent origination , karma and rebirth , the four noble truths , the noble eightfold path , and nirvana . SOS according to the UNK of the pli tradition , they started immediately after the second council , the UNK tradition places it in 137 an , the sarvastivada tradition of UNK says it was in the time of ashoka and the mahasanghika tradition places it much later , nearly 100 bce . EOS
SOS the UNK of the theravda says that the losing party in the second council dispute broke away in protest and formed the mahasanghika . EOS
SOS the UNK argued that the UNK were trying to expand the vinaya and may also have challenged what they perceived were excessive claims or UNK high criteria for UNK . EOS
SOS the UNK gave rise to several schools , one of which was the theravda school . EOS
SOS originally , these schisms were caused by disputes over vinaya , and monks following different schools of thought seem to have lived happily together in the same monasteries , but eventually , by about 100 ce if not earlier , schisms were being caused by doctrinal disagreements too . EOS
SOS originally , these schisms were caused by disputes over vinaya , and monks following different schools of thought seem to have lived happily together in the same monasteries , but eventually , by about 100 ce if not earlier , schisms were being caused by doctrinal disagreements too . EOS
SOS following -lrb- or leading up to -rrb- the schisms , each UNK started to accumulate an abhidharma , a detailed scholastic reworking of doctrinal material appearing in the suttas , according to UNK classifications . EOS
SOS these abhidharma texts do not contain systematic philosophical treatises , but summaries or numerical lists . EOS
SOS scholars generally date these texts to around the 3rd century bce , 100 to 200 years after the death of the buddha . EOS
SOS scholars disagree on whether the mahasanghika school had an abhidhamma pitaka or not . EOS

SOS there is no evidence that mahyna ever referred to a separate formal school or sect of buddhism , but rather that it existed as a certain set of ideals , and later doctrines , for bodhisattvas . EOS
SOS paul williams has also noted that the mahyna never had nor ever attempted to have a separate vinaya or ordination lineage from the early schools of buddhism , and therefore each UNK or UNK adhering to the mahyna formally belonged to an early school . EOS

SOS buddhism may have spread only slowly in india until the time of the mauryan emperor ashoka , who was a public supporter of the religion . EOS
SOS the support of aoka and his descendants led to the construction of more UNK -lrb- buddhist religious memorials -rrb- and to efforts to spread buddhism throughout the enlarged maurya empire and even into neighboring lands -- particularly to the UNK regions of afghanistan and central asia , beyond the UNK ' northwest border , and to the island of sri lanka south of india . EOS

SOS it is a matter of disagreement among scholars whether or not these emissaries were accompanied by buddhist missionaries . EOS

SOS hinayana -lrb- literally " lesser vehicle " -rrb- is used by mahayana followers to name the family of early philosophical schools and traditions from which contemporary theravada emerged , but as this term is rooted in the mahayana viewpoint and can be considered derogatory , a variety of other terms are increasingly used instead , including rvakayna , nikaya buddhism , early buddhist schools , sectarian buddhism , conservative buddhism , mainstream buddhism and non-mahayana buddhism . EOS
SOS hinayana -lrb- literally " lesser vehicle " -rrb- is used by mahayana followers to name the family of early philosophical schools and traditions from which contemporary theravada emerged , but as this term is rooted in the mahayana viewpoint and can be considered derogatory , a variety of other terms are increasingly used instead , including rvakayna , nikaya buddhism , early buddhist schools , sectarian buddhism , conservative buddhism , mainstream buddhism and non-mahayana buddhism . SOS for example , according to one buddhist ecumenical organization , -lsb- web 23 -rsb- several concepts common to both major buddhist branches : EOS
SOS theravada -lrb- " doctrine of the elders " , or " ancient doctrine " -rrb- is the oldest surviving buddhist school . EOS
SOS the name theravda comes from the ancestral UNK , one of the early buddhist schools , from which the UNK claim descent . EOS
SOS UNK buddhist reformers in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries portrayed the pali canon as the original version of scripture . EOS
SOS it has a growing presence in the west . EOS

SOS UNK can perform good actions , producing merit . EOS
SOS mahyna centres of learning were established , the most important one being the UNK university in north-eastern india . EOS
SOS mahayana schools recognize all or part of the mahayana sutras . EOS
SOS some of these sutras became for UNK a manifestation of the buddha himself , and faith in and veneration of those texts are stated in some sutras -lrb- e.g . the lotus sutra and the UNK sutra -rrb- to lay the foundations for the later attainment of buddhahood itself . EOS

SOS native mahayana buddhism is practiced today in china , japan , korea , singapore , parts of russia and most of vietnam -lrb- also commonly referred to as " eastern buddhism " -rrb- . EOS
SOS the buddhism practiced in tibet , the himalayan regions , and mongolia is also mahayana in origin , but is discussed below under the heading of vajrayana -lrb- also commonly referred to as " northern buddhism " -rrb- . EOS
SOS there are a variety of strands in eastern buddhism , of which " the pure land school of mahayana is the most widely practised today . " EOS

SOS buddhist scriptures and other texts exist in great variety . EOS
SOS some schools venerate certain texts as religious objects in themselves , while others take a more scholastic approach . EOS
SOS unlike many religions , buddhism has no single central text that is universally referred to by all traditions . EOS
SOS the tibetan buddhists have not even translated most of the UNK -lrb- though theoretically they recognize them -rrb- and they play no part in the religious life of either clergy or laity in china and japan . EOS
SOS however , some scholars have referred to the vinaya pitaka and the first four nikayas of the sutta pitaka as the common core of all buddhist traditions . EOS
SOS the size and complexity of the buddhist canons have been seen by some -lrb- including buddhist social reformer UNK ambedkar -rrb- as presenting barriers to the wider understanding of buddhist philosophy . EOS
SOS later in sri lanka , the UNK was championed as a unifying scripture . EOS
SOS over the years , various attempts have been made to synthesize a single buddhist text that can encompass all of the major principles of buddhism . EOS
SOS in the theravada tradition , condensed ` study texts ' were created that combined popular or influential scriptures into single volumes that could be studied by UNK monks . EOS
SOS dwight goddard collected a sample of buddhist scriptures , with the emphasis on zen , along with other classics of eastern philosophy , such as the UNK te ching , into his ` buddhist bible ' in the 1920s . EOS
SOS more recently , dr. UNK ambedkar attempted to create a single , combined document of buddhist principles in " the buddha and his dhamma " . EOS
SOS the pli tipitaka , which means " three baskets " , refers to the vinaya pitaka , the sutta pitaka , and the abhidhamma pitaka . EOS

SOS the mahayana sutras are a very broad genre of buddhist scriptures that the mahayana buddhist tradition holds are original teachings of the buddha . EOS
SOS the mahayana sutras are a very broad genre of buddhist scriptures that the mahayana buddhist tradition holds are original teachings of the buddha . EOS
SOS some adherents of mahayana accept both the early teachings -lrb- including in this the sarvastivada abhidharma , which was criticized by nagarjuna and is in fact opposed to early buddhist thought -rrb- and the mahayana sutras as authentic teachings of gautama buddha , and claim they were designed for different types of persons and different levels of spiritual understanding . SOS these texts were apparently not universally accepted among indian buddhists when they appeared ; the pejorative label hinayana was applied by mahayana supporters to those who rejected the mahayana sutras . EOS
SOS only the theravada school does not include the mahayana scriptures in its canon . EOS
SOS as the modern theravada school is descended from a branch of buddhism that diverged and established itself in sri lanka prior to the emergence of the mahayana texts , debate exists as to whether the theravada were historically included in the hinayana designation ; in the modern era , this label is seen as derogatory , and is generally avoided . SOS buddhism provides many opportunities for comparative study with a diverse range of subjects . EOS
SOS for example , buddhism 's emphasis on the middle way not only provides a unique guideline for ethics but has also allowed buddhism to peacefully coexist with various differing beliefs , customs and institutions in countries where it has resided throughout its history . EOS
SOS also , its moral and spiritual parallels with other systems of thought -- for example , with various tenets of christianity -- have been subjects of close study . EOS
SOS also , its moral and spiritual parallels with other systems of thought -- for example , with various tenets of christianity -- have been subjects of close study . EOS
SOS in addition , the buddhist concept of dependent origination has been compared to modern scientific thought , as well as western metaphysics . EOS
SOS there are differences of opinion on the question of whether or not buddhism should be considered a religion . EOS

SOS the UNK of dogs and humans would have greatly improved the chances of survival for early human groups , and the domestication of dogs may have been one of the key forces that led to human success . EOS
SOS studies suggesting that there are benefits to physical health and psychological UNK have been criticised for being poorly controlled , and finding that " -lsb- t -rsb- he health of elderly people is related to their health habits and social supports but not to their ownership of , or attachment to , a companion animal . " EOS
SOS earlier studies have shown that people who keep pet dogs or cats exhibit better mental and physical health than those who do not , making fewer visits to the doctor and being less likely to be on medication than UNK . EOS

SOS the ultimate substantive legacy of principia mathematica is mixed . EOS
SOS it is generally accepted that kurt gdel 's incompleteness theorem of 1931 definitively demonstrated that for any set of axioms and inference rules proposed to encapsulate mathematics , there would in fact be some truths of mathematics which could not be deduced from them , and hence that principia mathematica could never achieve its aims . SOS whitehead 's most complete work on education is the 1929 book the aims of education and other essays , which collected numerous essays and addresses by whitehead on the subject published between 1912 and 1927 . EOS
SOS in it , he cautioned against the teaching of what he called " inert ideas " -- ideas that are disconnected scraps of information , with no application to real life or culture . EOS
SOS rather than teach small parts of a large number of subjects , whitehead advocated teaching a relatively few important concepts that the student could organically link to many different areas of knowledge , discovering their application in actual life . EOS
SOS rather than teach small parts of a large number of subjects , whitehead advocated teaching a relatively few important concepts that the student could organically link to many different areas of knowledge , discovering their application in actual life . EOS
SOS for whitehead , education should be the exact opposite of the multidisciplinary , value-free school model -- it should be transdisciplinary , and laden with values and general principles that provide students with a bedrock of wisdom and help them to make connections between areas of knowledge that are usually regarded as separate . EOS

SOS in the notes of one his students for a 1927 class , whitehead was quoted as saying : " every scientific man in order to preserve his reputation has to say he dislikes metaphysics . EOS
SOS in whitehead 's view , scientists and philosophers make metaphysical assumptions about how the universe works all the time , but such assumptions are not easily seen precisely because they remain unexamined and unquestioned . EOS
SOS while whitehead acknowledged that " philosophers can never hope finally to formulate these metaphysical first principles , " he argued that people need to continually UNK their basic assumptions about how the universe works if philosophy and science are to make any real progress , even if that progress remains permanently asymptotic . EOS
SOS for this reason whitehead regarded metaphysical investigations as essential to both good science and good philosophy . EOS

SOS while whitehead acknowledged that " philosophers can never hope finally to formulate these metaphysical first principles , " he argued that people need to continually UNK their basic assumptions about how the universe works if philosophy and science are to make any real progress , even if that progress remains permanently asymptotic . EOS
SOS for this reason whitehead regarded metaphysical investigations as essential to both good science and good philosophy . EOS
SOS perhaps foremost among what whitehead considered faulty metaphysical assumptions was the cartesian idea that reality is fundamentally constructed of bits of matter that exist totally independently of one another , which he rejected in favor of an event-based or " process " ontology in which events are primary and are fundamentally interrelated and dependent on one another . EOS
SOS perhaps foremost among what whitehead considered faulty metaphysical assumptions was the cartesian idea that reality is fundamentally constructed of bits of matter that exist totally independently of one another , which he rejected in favor of an event-based or " process " ontology in which events are primary and are fundamentally interrelated and dependent on one another . EOS
SOS he used the term " experience " very broadly , so that even inanimate processes such as electron collisions are said to manifest some degree of experience . EOS
SOS in this , he went against descartes ' separation of two different kinds of real existence , either exclusively material or else exclusively mental . EOS
SOS whitehead referred to his metaphysical system as " philosophy of organism " , but it would become known more widely as " process philosophy . " EOS

EOS
SOS perhaps foremost among what whitehead considered faulty metaphysical assumptions was the cartesian idea that reality is fundamentally constructed of bits of matter that exist totally independently of one another , which he rejected in favor of an event-based or " process " ontology in which events are primary and are fundamentally interrelated and dependent on one another . EOS
SOS he also argued that the most basic elements of reality can all be regarded as experiential , indeed that everything is constituted by its experience . EOS
SOS whitehead referred to his metaphysical system as " philosophy of organism " , but it would become known more widely as " process philosophy . " EOS
SOS by assuming that enduring objects are the most real and fundamental things in the universe , materialists have mistaken the abstract for the concrete -lrb- what whitehead calls the " UNK of UNK UNK " -rrb- . EOS
SOS in whitehead 's view , then , concepts such as " quality " , " matter " , and " form " are problematic . EOS
SOS these " classical " concepts fail to adequately account for change , and overlook the active and experiential nature of the most basic elements of the world . EOS
SOS what is ordinarily conceived of as a single person , for instance , is philosophically described as a continuum of overlapping events . EOS
SOS these occasions of experience are logically distinct , but are progressively connected in what whitehead calls a " society " of events . EOS
SOS these " classical " concepts fail to adequately account for change , and overlook the active and experiential nature of the most basic elements of the world . EOS

SOS in whitehead 's view , then , concepts such as " quality " , " matter " , and " form " are problematic . EOS
SOS these occasions of experience are logically distinct , but are progressively connected in what whitehead calls a " society " of events . EOS
SOS what is ordinarily conceived of as a single person , for instance , is philosophically described as a continuum of overlapping events . EOS
SOS but in whitehead 's cosmology , the only fundamentally existent things are discrete " occasions of experience " that overlap one another in time and space , and jointly make up the enduring person or thing . EOS
SOS to put it another way , a thing or person is often seen as having a " defining essence " or a " core identity " that is unchanging , and describes what the thing or person really is . EOS
SOS in this way of thinking , things and people are seen as fundamentally the same through time , with any changes being qualitative and secondary to their core identity -lrb- e.g . " mark 's hair has turned gray as he has gotten older , but he is still the same person " -rrb- . EOS
SOS to put it another way , a thing or person is often seen as having a " defining essence " or a " core identity " that is unchanging , and describes what the thing or person really is . EOS
SOS but in whitehead 's cosmology , the only fundamentally existent things are discrete " occasions of experience " that overlap one another in time and space , and jointly make up the enduring person or thing . EOS
SOS but in whitehead 's cosmology , the only fundamentally existent things are discrete " occasions of experience " that overlap one another in time and space , and jointly make up the enduring person or thing . EOS
SOS everything changes from moment to moment , and to think of anything as having an " enduring essence " misses the fact that " all things flow " , though it is often a useful way of speaking . EOS
SOS identities do not define people , people define identities . EOS
SOS after all , each moment of each person 's life can hardly be given a different proper name , and it is easy and convenient to think of people and objects as remaining fundamentally the same things , rather than constantly keeping in mind that each thing is a different thing from what it was a moment ago . EOS
SOS yet the limitations of everyday living and everyday speech should not prevent people from realizing that " material substances " or " UNK " are a convenient generalized description of a continuum of particular , concrete processes . EOS
SOS whitehead pointed to the limitations of language as one of the main UNK in maintaining a materialistic way of thinking , and acknowledged that it may be difficult to ever wholly move past such ideas in everyday speech . EOS
SOS no one questions that a ten-year-old person is quite different by the time he or she turns thirty years old , and in many ways is not the same person at all ; whitehead points out that it is not philosophically or UNK sound to think that a person is the same from one second to the next . EOS

SOS each object is simply an inert UNK of matter that is only externally related to other things . EOS
SOS the idea of matter as primary makes people think of objects as being fundamentally separate in time and space , and not necessarily related to anything . EOS
SOS but in whitehead 's view , relations take a primary role , perhaps even more important than the UNK themselves . EOS
SOS it sees every object as distinct and discrete from all other objects . EOS
SOS a second problem with materialism is that it obscures the importance of relations . EOS
SOS a second problem with materialism is that it obscures the importance of relations . EOS
SOS it sees every object as distinct and discrete from all other objects . EOS
SOS each object is simply an inert UNK of matter that is only externally related to other things . EOS
SOS in fact , whitehead describes any entity as in some sense nothing more and nothing less than the sum of its relations to other entities -- its synthesis of and reaction to the world around it . EOS
SOS a real thing is just that which forces the rest of the universe to in some way conform to it ; that is to say , if theoretically a thing made strictly no difference to any other entity -lrb- i.e . it was not related to any other entity -rrb- , it could not be said to really exist . EOS
SOS a real thing is just that which forces the rest of the universe to in some way conform to it ; that is to say , if theoretically a thing made strictly no difference to any other entity -lrb- i.e . it was not related to any other entity -rrb- , it could not be said to really exist . EOS
SOS relations are not secondary to what a thing is , they are what the thing is . EOS

SOS indeed , in recent decades attention to whitehead 's work has become more widespread , with interest extending to intellectuals in europe and china , and coming from such diverse fields as ecology , physics , biology , education , economics , and psychology . EOS
SOS one of the first theologians to attempt to interact with whitehead 's thought was the future archbishop of canterbury , william temple . EOS
SOS in temple 's gifford lectures of UNK -lrb- subsequently published as " nature , man and god " -rrb- , whitehead is one of a number of philosophers of the emergent evolution approach temple interacts with . EOS
SOS isabelle stengers wrote that " UNK are recruited among both philosophers and theologians , and the palette has been enriched by practitioners from the most diverse horizons , from ecology to feminism , practices that unite political struggle and spirituality with the sciences of education . SOS early followers of whitehead were found primarily at the university of chicago 's divinity school , where henry nelson wieman initiated an interest in whitehead 's work that would last for about thirty years . EOS
SOS they taught generations of whitehead scholars , the most notable of which is john b. cobb , jr. . EOS
SOS professors such as wieman , charles hartshorne , bernard UNK , bernard UNK , and daniel day williams made whitehead 's philosophy arguably the most important intellectual thread running through the divinity school . EOS
SOS but while claremont remains the most concentrated hub of whiteheadian activity , the place where whitehead 's thought currently seems to be growing the most quickly is in china . EOS
SOS in order to address the challenges of modernization and industrialization , china has begun to blend traditions of taoism , buddhism , and confucianism with whitehead 's " constructive post-modern " philosophy in order to create an " ecological civilization . " EOS
SOS in order to address the challenges of modernization and industrialization , china has begun to blend traditions of taoism , buddhism , and confucianism with whitehead 's " constructive post-modern " philosophy in order to create an " ecological civilization . " EOS
SOS to date , the chinese government has encouraged the building of twenty-three university-based centers for the study of whitehead 's philosophy , and books by process philosophers john cobb and david ray griffin are becoming required reading for chinese graduate students . EOS
SOS cobb has attributed china 's interest in process philosophy partly to whitehead 's stress on the mutual interdependence of humanity and nature , as well as his emphasis on an educational system that includes the teaching of values rather than simply bare facts . EOS
SOS it is impossible to say exactly why whitehead 's influence has not been more widespread , but it may be partly due to his metaphysical ideas seeming somewhat counter-intuitive -lrb- such as his assertion that matter is an abstraction -rrb- , or his inclusion of theistic elements in his philosophy , or the perception of metaphysics itself as pass , or simply the sheer difficulty and density of his prose . SOS beginning in the late 1910s and early 1920s , whitehead gradually turned his attention from mathematics to philosophy of science , and finally to metaphysics . EOS
SOS whitehead argued that reality consists of processes rather than material objects , and that processes are best defined by their relations with other processes , thus rejecting the theory that reality is fundamentally constructed by bits of matter that exist independently of one another . EOS

SOS the two volume biography of whitehead by victor lowe is the most definitive presentation of the life of whitehead . EOS
SOS however , many details of whitehead 's life remain obscure because he left no UNK ; his family carried out his instructions that all of his papers be destroyed after his death . EOS

SOS for whitehead , creativity is the absolute principle of existence , and every entity -lrb- whether it is a human being , a tree , or an electron -rrb- has some degree of novelty in how it responds to other entities , and is not fully determined by causal or mechanistic laws . EOS
SOS it must be emphasized , however , that an entity is not merely a sum of its relations , but also a valuation of them and reaction to them . EOS
SOS of course , most entities do not have consciousness . EOS
SOS moreover , inability to predict an electron 's movement -lrb- for instance -rrb- is not due to faulty understanding or inadequate technology ; rather , the fundamental UNK of all entities means that there will always remain phenomena that are unpredictable . EOS

SOS the term he coined was " prehension " , which comes from the latin prehensio , meaning " to seize . " EOS
SOS it is also intended to make clear whitehead 's rejection of the theory of representative perception , in which the mind only has private ideas about other entities . EOS
SOS the term he coined was " prehension " , which comes from the latin prehensio , meaning " to seize . " EOS
SOS the term he coined was " prehension " , which comes from the latin prehensio , meaning " to seize . " EOS
SOS the term he coined was " prehension " , which comes from the latin prehensio , meaning " to seize . " EOS
SOS the term is meant to indicate a kind of perception that can be conscious or unconscious , applying to people as well as electrons . EOS
SOS further , whitehead regards perception as occurring in two modes , causal efficacy -lrb- or " physical prehension " -rrb- and presentational immediacy -lrb- or " conceptual prehension " -rrb- . EOS
SOS in this way , entities are constituted by their perceptions and relations , rather than being independent of them . EOS
SOS further , whitehead regards perception as occurring in two modes , causal efficacy -lrb- or " physical prehension " -rrb- and presentational immediacy -lrb- or " conceptual prehension " -rrb- . EOS
SOS it is , in other words , the sense of causal relations between entities , a feeling of being influenced and affected by the surrounding environment , unmediated by the senses . EOS
SOS whitehead describes causal efficacy as " the experience dominating the primitive living organisms , which have a sense for the fate from which they have emerged , and the fate towards which they go . " EOS
SOS presentational immediacy , on the other hand , is what is usually referred to as " pure sense perception " , unmediated by any causal or symbolic interpretation , even unconscious interpretation . EOS
SOS whitehead describes causal efficacy as " the experience dominating the primitive living organisms , which have a sense for the fate from which they have emerged , and the fate towards which they go . " EOS
SOS presentational immediacy , on the other hand , is what is usually referred to as " pure sense perception " , unmediated by any causal or symbolic interpretation , even unconscious interpretation . EOS
SOS in this way symbolic reference is a fusion of pure sense perceptions on the one hand and causal relations on the other , and that it is in fact the causal relationships that dominate the more basic mentality -lrb- as the dog illustrates -rrb- , while it is the sense perceptions which indicate a higher grade mentality -lrb- as the artist illustrates -rrb- . EOS
SOS in higher organisms -lrb- like people -rrb- , these two modes of perception combine into what whitehead terms " symbolic reference " , which links appearance with causation in a process that is so automatic that both people and animals have difficulty refraining from it . EOS

SOS an ordinary person looks up , sees a colored shape , and immediately UNK that it is a chair . EOS
SOS however , an artist , whitehead UNK , " might not have jumped to the notion of a chair " , but instead " might have stopped at the mere contemplation of a beautiful color and a beautiful shape . " EOS
SOS using the same example , whitehead points out that a dog " would have acted immediately on the hypothesis of a chair and would have jumped onto it by way of using it as such . " EOS
SOS whitehead makes the startling observation that " life is comparatively deficient in survival value . " EOS
SOS he then observes that the mark of higher forms of life is that they are actively engaged in modifying their environment , an activity which he theorizes is directed toward the three-fold goal of living , living well , and living better . EOS
SOS he then observes that the mark of higher forms of life is that they are actively engaged in modifying their environment , an activity which he theorizes is directed toward the three-fold goal of living , living well , and living better . EOS
SOS in other words , whitehead sees life as directed toward the purpose of increasing its own satisfaction . EOS

SOS if humans can only exist for about a hundred years , and rocks for eight hundred million , then one is forced to ask why complex organisms ever evolved in the first place ; as whitehead humorously notes , " they certainly did not appear because they were better at that game than the rocks around them . " EOS
SOS as opposed to the most widely accepted forms of christianity , whitehead emphasized an idea of god that he called " the brief galilean vision of UNK " : EOS
SOS perhaps his most famous and pointed criticism of the christian conception of god is that " the church gave unto god the attributes which belonged exclusively to caesar . " EOS
SOS here whitehead is criticizing christianity for defining god as primarily a divine king who imposes his will on the world , and whose most important attribute is power . EOS
SOS it should be emphasized , however , that for whitehead god is not necessarily tied to religion . EOS
SOS whitehead posited that these ordered potentials exist in what he called the primordial nature of god . EOS
SOS this led him to reflect more intensively on what he saw as the second nature of god , the consequent nature . EOS
SOS whitehead 's conception of god as a " UNK " entity has called for fresh theological thinking . EOS
SOS his system required that an order exist among possibilities , an order that allowed for novelty in the world and provided an aim to all entities . EOS
SOS god 's consequent nature , on the other hand , is anything but unchanging -- it is god 's reception of the world 's activity . EOS
SOS in other words , god saves and UNK all experiences forever , and those experiences go on to change the way god interacts with the world . EOS
SOS it is the judgment of a UNK which loses nothing that can be saved . " EOS
SOS in other words , god saves and UNK all experiences forever , and those experiences go on to change the way god interacts with the world . EOS
SOS in this way , god is really changed by what happens in the world and the wider universe , lending the actions of finite creatures an eternal significance . EOS
SOS on the other hand , he sees god as permanent but as deficient in actuality and change : alone , god is merely eternally UNK possibilities , and requires the world to UNK them . EOS

SOS whitehead thus sees god and the world as fulfilling one another . EOS
SOS he sees entities in the world as fluent and changing things that yearn for a permanence which only god can provide by taking them into god 's self , thereafter changing god and affecting the rest of the universe throughout time . EOS

SOS for whitehead the core of religion was individual . EOS
SOS his most famous remark on religion is that " religion is what the individual does with his own solitariness ... and if you are never solitary , you are never religious . " EOS
SOS whitehead saw religion as a system of general truths that transformed a person 's character . EOS
SOS he took special care to note that while religion is often a good influence , it is not necessarily good -- an idea which he called a " dangerous delusion " -lrb- e.g . , a religion might encourage the violent extermination of a rival religion 's adherents -rrb- . EOS
SOS however , while whitehead saw religion as beginning in solitariness , he also saw religion as necessarily expanding beyond the individual . EOS
SOS in keeping with his process metaphysics in which relations are primary , he wrote that religion UNK the realization of " the value of the objective world which is a community derivative from the UNK of its component individuals . " EOS
SOS in other words , the universe is a community which makes itself whole through the UNK of each individual entity to all the others -- meaning and value do not exist for the individual alone , but only in the context of the universal community . EOS
SOS in this way the individual and UNK aspects of religion are mutually dependent . EOS
SOS outside of these circles his influence is relatively small and diffuse , and has tended to come chiefly through the work of his students and admirers rather than whitehead himself . EOS

SOS historically whitehead 's work has been most influential in the field of american progressive theology . EOS

SOS whitehead also described religion more technically as " an ultimate craving to UNK into the insistent UNK of emotion that UNK generality which primarily belongs to conceptual thought alone . " EOS
SOS in other words , religion takes deeply felt emotions and contextualizes them within a system of general truths about the world , helping people to identify their wider meaning and significance . EOS
SOS for whitehead , religion served as a kind of bridge between philosophy and the emotions and purposes of a particular society . EOS
SOS it is the task of religion to make philosophy applicable to the everyday lives of ordinary people . EOS

SOS prior to the crisis , financial institutions became highly leveraged , increasing their appetite for risky investments and reducing their resilience in case of losses . EOS
SOS much of this leverage was achieved using complex financial instruments such as off-balance sheet securitization and derivatives , which made it difficult for creditors and regulators to monitor and try to reduce financial institution risk levels . EOS
SOS these instruments also made it virtually impossible to reorganize financial institutions in bankruptcy , and contributed to the need for government bailouts . EOS

SOS the financial crisis was triggered by a complex interplay of policies that encouraged home ownership , providing easier access to loans for subprime borrowers , overvaluation of bundled subprime mortgages based on the theory that housing prices would continue to escalate , questionable trading practices on behalf of both buyers and sellers , compensation structures that prioritize short-term deal flow over long-term value creation , and a lack of adequate capital holdings from banks and insurance companies to back the financial commitments they were making . SOS the u.s. financial crisis inquiry commission reported its findings in january 2011 . EOS
SOS it concluded that " the crisis was avoidable and was caused by : widespread failures in financial regulation , including the federal reserve 's failure to stem the tide of toxic mortgages ; dramatic breakdowns in corporate governance including too many financial firms acting recklessly and taking on too much risk ; an explosive mix of excessive borrowing and risk by households and wall street that put the financial system on a collision course with crisis ; key policy makers ill prepared for the crisis , lacking a full understanding of the financial system they oversaw ; and systemic breaches in accountability and ethics at all levels " . SOS st. barthlemy is separated from saint martin by the saint-barthlemy channel . EOS

SOS tourism attracts about 200,000 visitors every year . EOS
SOS international investment and the wealth generated by wealthy tourists explain the high standard of living on the island . EOS
SOS most of the food is imported by airplane or boat from the us or france . EOS
SOS st. barthlemy has about 25 hotels , most of them with 15 rooms or fewer . EOS
SOS the largest has 58 rooms . EOS
SOS it also attracts a labour force from brazil and portugal to meet the industry needs . EOS
SOS hotel le UNK , the most expensive hotel on the island , has 12 rooms . EOS
SOS most places of accommodation are in the form of private villas , of which there are some 400 available to rent on the island . EOS
SOS as the terrain is generally arid , the hills have mostly poor soil and support only cacti and succulent plants . EOS
SOS the eastern part of the island is greener as it receives more rainfall . EOS
SOS a 1994 survey has revealed several hundred indigenous species of plants including the naturalized varieties of flora ; some growing in irrigated areas while the dry areas are dominated by the cacti variety . EOS
SOS sea grapes and palm trees are a common sight with UNK and shrubs surviving in the saline coastal swamps . EOS

SOS in modern molecular biology and genetics , the genome is the genetic material of an organism . EOS
SOS the term was created in 1920 by hans winkler , professor of botany at the university of hamburg , germany . EOS
SOS the term was created in 1920 by hans winkler , professor of botany at the university of hamburg , germany . EOS
SOS a few related - UNK words already existed -- such as biome , UNK , forming a vocabulary into which genome fits systematically . EOS
SOS in classical genetics , in a sexually reproducing organism -lrb- typically UNK -rrb- the UNK has half the number of chromosomes of the somatic cell and the genome is a full set of chromosomes in a diploid cell . EOS
SOS the halving of the genetic material in gametes is accomplished by the segregation of homologous chromosomes during meiosis . EOS
SOS in haploid organisms , including cells of bacteria , archaea , and in organelles including mitochondria and chloroplasts , or viruses , that similarly contain genes , the single or set of circular or linear chains of dna -lrb- or rna for some viruses -rrb- , likewise constitute the genome . EOS
SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- the study of the global properties of genomes of related organisms is usually referred to as genomics , which distinguishes it from genetics which generally studies the properties of single genes or groups of genes . EOS
SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- the study of the global properties of genomes of related organisms is usually referred to as genomics , which distinguishes it from genetics which generally studies the properties of single genes or groups of genes . EOS
SOS when people say that the genome of a sexually reproducing species has been " sequenced " , typically they are referring to a determination of the sequences of one set of UNK and one of each type of sex chromosome , which together represent both of the possible sexes . EOS
SOS both the number of base pairs and the number of genes vary widely from one species to another , and there is only a rough correlation between the two -lrb- an observation known as the UNK paradox -rrb- . EOS
SOS at present , the highest known number of genes is around 60,000 , for the protozoan causing trichomoniasis -lrb- see list of sequenced eukaryotic genomes -rrb- , almost three times as many as in the human genome . EOS
SOS at present , the highest known number of genes is around 60,000 , for the protozoan causing trichomoniasis -lrb- see list of sequenced eukaryotic genomes -rrb- , almost three times as many as in the human genome . EOS
SOS at present , the highest known number of genes is around 60,000 , for the protozoan causing trichomoniasis -lrb- see list of sequenced eukaryotic genomes -rrb- , almost three times as many as in the human genome . EOS
SOS in 1976 , walter fiers at the university of ghent -lrb- belgium -rrb- was the first to establish the complete nucleotide sequence of a viral UNK -lrb- bacteriophage ms2 -rrb- . EOS
SOS in 1976 , walter fiers at the university of ghent -lrb- belgium -rrb- was the first to establish the complete nucleotide sequence of a viral UNK -lrb- bacteriophage ms2 -rrb- . EOS
SOS the next year fred sanger completed the first UNK sequence : phage UNK , of UNK base pairs . EOS
SOS the first complete genome sequences among all three domains of life were released within a short period during the mid-1990s : the first bacterial genome to be sequenced was that of UNK UNK , completed by a team at the institute for genomic research in 1995 . EOS
SOS the first genome sequence for an UNK , UNK UNK , was completed in 1996 , again by the institute for genomic research . EOS
SOS the us national institutes of health maintains one of several comprehensive databases of genomic information . EOS
SOS among the thousands of completed genome sequencing projects include those for rice , a mouse , the plant arabidopsis thaliana , the UNK fish , and the bacteria e. coli . EOS
SOS among the thousands of completed genome sequencing projects include those for rice , a mouse , the plant arabidopsis thaliana , the UNK fish , and the bacteria e. coli . EOS
SOS in december 2013 , scientists first sequenced the entire genome of a neanderthal , an extinct species of humans . EOS
SOS the genome was extracted from the toe bone of a UNK neanderthal found in a siberian cave . EOS
SOS new sequencing technologies , such as massive parallel sequencing have also opened up the prospect of personal genome sequencing as a diagnostic tool , as pioneered by UNK predictive medicine . EOS
SOS new sequencing technologies , such as massive parallel sequencing have also opened up the prospect of personal genome sequencing as a diagnostic tool , as pioneered by UNK predictive medicine . EOS
SOS a major step toward that goal was the completion in 2007 of the full genome of james d. watson , one of the co-discoverers of the structure of dna . EOS
SOS a major step toward that goal was the completion in 2007 of the full genome of james d. watson , one of the co-discoverers of the structure of dna . EOS
SOS whereas a genome sequence lists the order of every dna base in a genome , a genome map identifies the landmarks . EOS
SOS the human genome project was organized to map and to sequence the human genome . EOS
SOS a fundamental step in the project was the release of a detailed genomic map by jean UNK and his team at the UNK in paris . EOS
SOS a fundamental step in the project was the release of a detailed genomic map by jean UNK and his team at the UNK in paris . EOS
SOS genome composition is used to describe the make up of contents of a haploid genome , which should include genome size , proportions of non-repetitive dna and repetitive dna in details . EOS
SOS by comparing the genome compositions between genomes , scientists can better understand the evolutionary history of a given genome . EOS
SOS when talking about genome composition , one should distinguish between prokaryotes and eukaryotes as the big differences on contents structure they have . EOS
SOS in mammals and plants , the major part of the genome is composed of repetitive dna . EOS
SOS in some contexts , such as sequencing the genome of a pathogenic UNK , " genome " is meant to include information stored on this auxiliary material , which is carried in plasmids . EOS
SOS most biological entities that are more complex than a virus sometimes or always carry additional genetic material besides that which resides in their chromosomes . EOS
SOS in some contexts , such as sequencing the genome of a pathogenic UNK , " genome " is meant to include information stored on this auxiliary material , which is carried in plasmids . EOS
SOS in eukaryotes such as plants , UNK and animals , however , " genome " carries the typical connotation of only information on chromosomal dna . EOS
SOS the dna found within the chloroplast may be referred to as the " UNK " . EOS
SOS in fact , mitochondria are sometimes said to have their own genome often referred to as the " mitochondrial genome " . EOS
SOS genome size is the total number of dna base pairs in one copy of a haploid genome . EOS
SOS the genome size is positively correlated with the morphological complexity among prokaryotes and lower eukaryotes ; however , after mollusks and all the other higher eukaryotes above , this correlation is no longer effective . EOS
SOS protein-coding genes and rna-coding genes are generally non-repetitive dna . EOS
SOS the proportion of non-repetitive dna is calculated by using the length of non-repetitive dna divided by genome size . EOS
SOS the proportion of non-repetitive dna is calculated by using the length of non-repetitive dna divided by genome size . EOS
SOS some e. coli as prokaryotes only have non-repetitive dna , lower eukaryotes such as c. elegans and fruit fly , still possess more non-repetitive dna than repetitive dna . EOS
SOS some e. coli as prokaryotes only have non-repetitive dna , lower eukaryotes such as c. elegans and fruit fly , still possess more non-repetitive dna than repetitive dna . EOS
SOS in some plants and amphibians , the proportion of non-repetitive dna is no more than 20 % , becoming a minority component . EOS
SOS there are two categories of repetitive dna in genome : tandem repeats and interspersed repeats . EOS
SOS the proportion of repetitive dna is calculated by using length of repetitive dna divide by genome size . EOS
SOS tandem repeats are usually caused by UNK during replication , unequal crossing-over and gene conversion , satellite dna and UNK are forms of tandem repeats in the genome . EOS
SOS tandem repeats are usually caused by UNK during replication , unequal crossing-over and gene conversion , satellite dna and UNK are forms of tandem repeats in the genome . EOS
SOS although tandem repeats count for a significant proportion in genome , the largest proportion in mammalian is the other type , interspersed repeats . EOS
SOS it is believed that tes are an important driving force on genome evolution of higher eukaryotes . EOS
SOS tes can be classified into two categories , class 1 -lrb- retrotransposons -rrb- and class 2 -lrb- dna transposons -rrb- . EOS
SOS tes can be classified into two categories , class 1 -lrb- retrotransposons -rrb- and class 2 -lrb- dna transposons -rrb- . EOS
SOS retrotransposons can be transcribed into rna , which are then duplicated at another site into the genome . EOS
SOS dna transposons generally move by " cut and paste " in the genome , but duplication has also been observed . EOS
SOS class 2 tes do not use rna as intermediate and are popular in bacteria , in metazoan it has also been found . EOS
SOS researchers compare traits such as chromosome number -lrb- UNK -rrb- , genome size , gene order , codon usage bias , and UNK to determine what mechanisms could have produced the great variety of genomes that exist today -lrb- for recent UNK , see brown 2002 ; UNK and UNK 2003 ; UNK and UNK 2004 ; gibson and muse 2004 ; reese 2004 ; gregory 2005 -rrb- . EOS
SOS UNK play a major role in shaping the genome . EOS
SOS such UNK are probably fundamental to the creation of genetic novelty . EOS
SOS horizontal gene transfer seems to be common among many microbes . EOS
SOS also , eukaryotic cells seem to have experienced a transfer of some genetic material from their chloroplast and mitochondrial genomes to their nuclear chromosomes . EOS
SOS a comprehensive school is a state school that does not select its intake on the basis of academic achievement or aptitude . EOS
SOS this is in contrast to the selective school system , where admission is restricted on the basis of selection criteria . EOS
SOS the term is commonly used in relation to england and wales , where comprehensive schools were introduced on an experimental basis in the 1940s and became more widespread from 1965 . EOS
SOS about 90 % of british secondary school pupils now attend comprehensive schools . EOS
SOS they correspond broadly to the public high school in the united states and canada and to the german gesamtschule . EOS
SOS a consequence of that is a wider ranging curriculum , including practical subjects such as design and technology and vocational learning , which were less common or non-existent in grammar schools . EOS
SOS this is why schools have tended to get larger and also why many local authorities have organised secondary education into 11 -- 16 schools , with the UNK provision provided by sixth form colleges and further education colleges . EOS
SOS in addition , government initiatives such as the city technology colleges and specialist schools programmes have made the comprehensive ideal less certain . EOS
SOS although comprehensive schools were introduced to england and wales in 1965 , there are 164 selective grammar schools that are still in operation . EOS
SOS although comprehensive schools were introduced to england and wales in 1965 , there are 164 selective grammar schools that are still in operation . EOS
SOS in principle , comprehensive schools were conceived as " neighbourhood " schools for all students in a specified UNK area . EOS
SOS current education reforms with academies programme , free schools and university technical colleges will no doubt have some impact on the comprehensive ideal but it is too early to say to what degree . EOS
SOS finland has used comprehensive schools since the 1970s , in the sense that everyone is expected to complete the nine grades of UNK , from the age 7 to 16 . EOS
SOS finland has used comprehensive schools since the 1970s , in the sense that everyone is expected to complete the nine grades of UNK , from the age 7 to 16 . EOS
SOS germany has a comprehensive school known as the gesamtschule . EOS
SOS they offer college preparatory classes for the students who are doing well , general education classes for average students , and remedial courses for those who are n't doing that well . EOS
SOS in most cases students attending a gesamtschule may graduate with the UNK , the UNK or the abitur depending on how well they did in school . EOS
SOS in the state of brandenburg more than 50 % of all students attended a gesamtschule in 2007 , while in the state of bavaria less than 1 % did . EOS
SOS in the state of brandenburg more than 50 % of all students attended a gesamtschule in 2007 , while in the state of bavaria less than 1 % did . EOS

SOS the " UNK " is a school in some states of germany that offers regular classes and remedial classes but no college preparatory classes . EOS
SOS students may be awarded the UNK or the UNK UNK but not the abitur . EOS
SOS in some states of germany , the hauptschule does not exist , and any student who has not been accepted by another school has to attend the UNK . EOS
SOS comprehensive schools have been accused of grade inflation after a study revealed that gymnasium senior students of average mathematical ability found themselves at the very bottom of their class and had an average grade of " five " , which means " failed " . EOS
SOS barbara sommer -lrb- christian democratic union -rrb- , education minister of north rhine-westphalia , commented that : looking at the performance gap between comprehensives and the gymnasium -lsb- at the abitur central examination -rsb- -lsb- ... -rsb- it is difficult to understand why the social democratic party of germany wants to do away with the gymnasium . SOS as a reaction , UNK beer -lrb- alliance ' 90/the greens -rrb- stated that comprehensives were structurally discriminated against by the government , which favoured the gymnasiums . EOS
SOS it could be shown that an achievement gap opens between working class students attending a comprehensive and their middle class peers . EOS
SOS however it is not students attending a comprehensive , but students attending a hauptschule , who perform the poorest . EOS
SOS according to a study done by helmut fend -lrb- who had always been a fierce proponent of comprehensive schools -rrb- revealed that comprehensive schools do not help working class students . EOS

SOS the comprehensive school system is still relatively small and to an extent has been superseded by the community school concept . EOS
SOS in ireland comprehensive schools were an earlier model of state schools , introduced in the late 1960s and largely replaced by the secular community model of the 1970s . EOS
SOS the state owns the school property , which is vested in the trustees in perpetuity . EOS
SOS the introduction of the community school model in the 1970s controversially removed the denominational basis of the schools , but religious interests were invited to be represented on the boards of management . EOS
SOS community colleges tended to be amalgamations of UNK local schools under the umbrella of a new community school model , but community schools have tended to be entirely new foundations . EOS

SOS secondary technical schools were never widely implemented and for 20 years there was a virtual UNK system which saw fierce competition for the available grammar school places , which varied between 15 % and 25 % of total secondary places , depending on location . EOS
SOS in 1970 margaret thatcher became secretary of state for education of the new conservative government . EOS
SOS she ended the UNK on local authorities to convert , however , many local authorities were so far down the path that it would have been prohibitively expensive to attempt to reverse the process , and more comprehensive schools were established under mrs thatcher than any other education secretary . SOS by 1975 the majority of local authorities in england and wales had abandoned the UNK examination and moved to a comprehensive system . EOS
SOS over that 10-year period many secondary modern schools and grammar schools were amalgamated to form large neighbourhood comprehensives , whilst a number of new schools were built to accommodate a growing school population . EOS

SOS the region was dominated by bantu-speaking tribes , who built trade links leading into the congo river basin . EOS
SOS upon independence in 1960 , the former colony of french congo became the republic of the congo . EOS

SOS under the 1963 constitution , massamba-dbat was elected president for a five-year term . EOS

SOS marien ngouabi , who had participated in the coup , assumed the presidency on december 31 , 1968 . EOS

SOS a prime minister is the most senior minister of cabinet in the executive branch of government , often in a parliamentary or semi-presidential system . EOS
SOS a prime minister is the most senior minister of cabinet in the executive branch of government , often in a parliamentary or semi-presidential system . EOS
SOS in a minority of systems , notably in semi-presidential systems of government , a prime minister is the official who is appointed to manage the civil service and execute the directives of the head of state . EOS
SOS in parliamentary systems fashioned after the westminster system , the prime minister is the presiding and actual head of government and head of the executive branch . EOS
SOS in such systems , the head of state or the head of state 's official representative -lrb- i.e . the monarch , president , or governor-general -rrb- usually holds a largely ceremonial position , although often with reserve powers . EOS
SOS the prime minister is often , but not always , a member of parliament -lsb- clarification needed -rsb- and is expected with other ministers to ensure the passage of bills through the legislature . EOS
SOS in some monarchies the monarch may also exercise executive powers -lrb- known as the royal prerogative -rrb- that are constitutionally vested in the crown and may be exercised without the approval of parliament . EOS
SOS as well as being head of government , a prime minister may have other roles or titles -- the prime minister of the united kingdom , for example , is also first lord of the treasury and minister for the civil service . EOS
SOS prime ministers may take other ministerial posts -- for example , during the second world war , winston churchill was also minister of defence -lrb- although there was then no ministry of defence -rrb- , and in the current cabinet of israel , benjamin netanyahu also serves as minister of communications , foreign affairs , regional cooperation , economy and interior EOS

SOS from 1721 this was the whig politician robert walpole , who held office for twenty-one years . EOS
SOS under walpole , the doctrine of cabinet solidarity developed . EOS
SOS walpole required that no minister other than himself have private dealings with the king , and also that when the cabinet had agreed on a policy , all ministers must defend it in public , or resign . EOS
SOS as a later prime minister , lord melbourne , said , " it matters not what we say , gentlemen , so long as we all say the same thing . " EOS
SOS walpole always denied that he was " prime minister " , and throughout the 18th century parliamentarians and legal scholars continued to deny that any such position was known to the constitution . EOS
SOS george ii and george iii made UNK efforts to reclaim the personal power of the monarch , but the increasing complexity and expense of government meant that a minister who could command the loyalty of the commons was increasingly necessary . EOS
SOS the title was first referred to on government documents during the administration of benjamin disraeli but did not appear in the formal british order of precedence until 1905 . EOS

SOS the wayback machine is a digital archive of the world wide web and other information on the internet created by the internet archive , a nonprofit organization , based in san francisco , california , united states . EOS

SOS the wayback machine is a digital archive of the world wide web and other information on the internet created by the internet archive , a nonprofit organization , based in san francisco , california , united states . EOS
SOS it was set up by brewster kahle and bruce UNK , and is maintained with content from alexa internet . EOS
SOS the service enables users to see archived versions of web pages across time , which the archive calls a " three dimensional index . " EOS
SOS the name wayback machine was chosen as a UNK reference to a plot device in an animated cartoon series , the rocky and UNK show . EOS
SOS in one of the animated cartoon 's component segments , peabody 's improbable history , lead characters mr. peabody and sherman routinely used a time machine called the " UNK machine " -lrb- pronounced way-back -rrb- to witness , participate in , and , more often than not , alter famous events in history . EOS
