SOS in 1996 brewster kahle , with bruce UNK , developed software to crawl and download all publicly accessible world wide web pages , the UNK hierarchy , the UNK -lrb- usenet -rrb- bulletin board system , and downloadable software . EOS
SOS the information collected by these " crawlers " does not include all the information available on the internet , since much of the data is restricted by the publisher or stored in databases that are not accessible . EOS
SOS these " crawlers " also respect the robots exclusion standard for websites whose owners opt for them not to appear in search results or be UNK . EOS
SOS information had been kept on digital tape for five years , with kahle occasionally allowing researchers and scientists to tap into the UNK database . EOS
SOS when the archive reached its fifth anniversary , it was unveiled and opened to the public in a ceremony at the university of california , berkeley . EOS
SOS when the archive reached its fifth anniversary , it was unveiled and opened to the public in a ceremony at the university of california , berkeley . EOS
SOS snapshots usually become available more than six months after they are archived or , in some cases , even later ; it can take twenty-four months or longer . EOS
SOS the frequency of snapshots is variable , so not all tracked web site updates are recorded . EOS
SOS after august 2008 sites had to be listed on the open directory in order to be included . EOS

SOS the dutch republic , also known as the republic of the seven united netherlands -lrb- republiek der zeven verenigde UNK -rrb- , republic of the united netherlands or republic of the seven united provinces -lrb- republiek der zeven verenigde UNK -rrb- , was a republic in europe existing from 1581 , when part of the netherlands separated from spanish rule , until 1795 . EOS
SOS it preceded the batavian republic , the kingdom of holland , the united kingdom of the netherlands , and ultimately the modern kingdom of the netherlands . EOS
SOS until the 16th century , the low countries -- corresponding roughly to the present-day netherlands , belgium , and luxembourg -- consisted of a number of duchies , counties , and UNK , almost all of which were under the supremacy of the holy roman empire , with the exception of the county of flanders , which was under the kingdom of france . SOS most of the low countries had come under the rule of the house of burgundy and subsequently the house of habsburg . EOS
SOS in UNK holy roman emperor charles v issued the pragmatic sanction , which further unified the seventeen provinces under his rule . EOS

SOS the netherlands regained independence from france in 1813 . EOS
SOS in the anglo-dutch treaty of 1814 the names " united provinces of the netherlands " and " united netherlands " were used . EOS
SOS in 1815 it was rejoined with the austrian netherlands , luxembourg and lige -lrb- the " southern provinces " -rrb- to become the kingdom of the netherlands , informally known as the kingdom of the united netherlands , to create a strong buffer state north of france . EOS
SOS during the dutch golden age in the late 16th century onward , the dutch republic dominated world trade in the 17th century , conquering a vast colonial empire and operating the largest fleet of UNK of any nation . EOS
SOS the county of holland was the wealthiest and most urbanized region in the world . EOS
SOS the netherlands has the oldest stock exchange in the world , founded in 1602 by the dutch east india company . EOS
SOS while rotterdam has the oldest UNK in the netherlands , the world 's first stock exchange -- that of the dutch UNK company -- went public in six different cities . EOS

SOS the republic was a confederation of seven provinces , which had their own governments and were very independent , and a number of so-called generality lands . EOS
SOS the latter were governed directly by the states general -lrb- UNK in dutch -rrb- , the federal government . EOS
SOS the states general were seated in the hague and consisted of representatives of each of the seven provinces . EOS
SOS in fact , there was an eighth province , the county of drenthe , but this area was so poor it was exempt from paying federal taxes and as a consequence was denied representation in the states general . EOS
SOS in fact , there was an eighth province , the county of drenthe , but this area was so poor it was exempt from paying federal taxes and as a consequence was denied representation in the states general . EOS
SOS each province was governed by the provincial states , the main executive official -lrb- though not the official head of state -rrb- was a raadspensionaris . EOS
SOS in times of war , the stadtholder , who commanded the army , would have more power than the raadspensionaris . EOS
SOS in times of war , the stadtholder , who commanded the army , would have more power than the raadspensionaris . EOS
SOS in theory , the stadtholders were freely appointed by and subordinate to the states of each province . EOS
SOS however , in practice the princes of orange of the house of UNK , beginning with william the silent , were always chosen as stadtholders of most of the provinces . EOS
SOS zeeland and usually utrecht had the same stadtholder as holland . EOS
SOS there was a constant power struggle between the orangists , who supported the stadtholders and specifically the princes of orange , and the republicans , who supported the states general and hoped to replace the semi-hereditary nature of the UNK with a true republican structure . EOS

SOS after the peace of westphalia , several border territories were assigned to the united provinces . EOS
SOS the states general of the united provinces were in control of the dutch east india company -lrb- voc -rrb- and the dutch west india company -lrb- UNK -rrb- , but some shipping expeditions were initiated by some of the provinces , mostly holland and/or zeeland . EOS

SOS apart from this , the american declaration of independence is similar to the act of abjuration , essentially the declaration of independence of the united provinces , but concrete evidence that the former directly influenced the latter is absent . EOS
SOS in the union of utrecht of 20 january 1579 , holland and zeeland were granted the right to accept only one religion -lrb- in practice , calvinism -rrb- . EOS
SOS every other province had the freedom to regulate the religious question as it wished , although the union stated every person should be free in the choice of personal religion and that no person should be prosecuted based on religious choice . EOS
SOS william of orange had been a strong supporter of public and personal freedom of religion and hoped to unite protestants and catholics in the new union , and , for him , the union was a defeat . EOS
SOS in practice , catholic services in all provinces were quickly forbidden , and the reformed church became the " public " or " privileged " church in the republic . EOS
SOS during the republic , any person who wished to hold public office had to conform to the reformed church and take an oath to this effect . EOS
SOS the extent to which different religions or denominations were persecuted depended much on the time period and regional or city leaders . EOS
SOS in 17th-century leiden , for instance , people opening their homes to services could be fined 200 guilders -lrb- a year 's wage for a skilled UNK -rrb- and banned from the city . EOS
SOS throughout this , however , personal freedom of religion existed and was one factor -- along with economic reasons -- in causing large immigration of religious refugees from other parts of europe . EOS
SOS in the first years of the republic , controversy arose within the reformed church , mainly around the subject of predestination . EOS
SOS this has become known as the struggle between UNK and UNK , or between UNK and UNK . EOS
SOS in 1618 the synod of UNK tackled this issue , which led to the banning of the UNK faith . EOS
SOS beginning in the 18th century , the situation changed from more or less active persecution of religious services to a state of restricted toleration of other religions , as long as their services took place secretly in private churches . EOS
SOS beginning in the 18th century , the situation changed from more or less active persecution of religious services to a state of restricted toleration of other religions , as long as their services took place secretly in private churches . EOS
SOS symbiosis -lrb- from greek " together " and " living " -rrb- is close and often long-term interaction between two different biological species . EOS
SOS in 1877 albert UNK frank used the word symbiosis -lrb- which previously had been used to depict people living together in community -rrb- to describe the mutualistic relationship in lichens . EOS
SOS in 1879 , the german UNK heinrich anton de UNK defined it as " the living together of unlike organisms . " EOS
SOS after 130 years of debate , current biology and ecology textbooks now use the latter " de UNK " definition or an even broader definition -lrb- where symbiosis means all species interactions -rrb- , with the restrictive definition no longer used -lrb- in other words , symbiosis means mutualism -rrb- . EOS
SOS some symbiotic relationships are obligate , meaning that both symbionts entirely depend on each other for survival . EOS
SOS others are UNK -lrb- optional -rrb- : they can , but do not have to live with the other organism . EOS
SOS for example , many lichens consist of fungal and photosynthetic symbionts that can not live on their own . EOS
SOS symbiotic relationships include those associations in which one organism lives on another -lrb- ectosymbiosis , such as mistletoe -rrb- , or where one partner lives inside the other -lrb- endosymbiosis , such as lactobacilli and other bacteria in humans or UNK in corals -rrb- . EOS
SOS symbiosis is also classified by physical attachment of the organisms ; symbiosis in which the organisms have bodily union is called UNK symbiosis , and symbiosis in which they are not in union is called UNK symbiosis . EOS
SOS symbiotic relationships include those associations in which one organism lives on another -lrb- ectosymbiosis , such as mistletoe -rrb- , or where one partner lives inside the other -lrb- endosymbiosis , such as lactobacilli and other bacteria in humans or UNK in corals -rrb- . EOS
SOS examples include diverse microbiomes , rhizobia , nitrogen-fixing bacteria that live in root nodules on legume roots ; actinomycete nitrogen-fixing bacteria called frankia , which live in alder tree root nodules ; single-celled algae inside reef-building corals ; and bacterial endosymbionts that provide essential nutrients to about 10 % -- 15 % of insects . EOS
SOS examples include diverse microbiomes , rhizobia , nitrogen-fixing bacteria that live in root nodules on legume roots ; actinomycete nitrogen-fixing bacteria called frankia , which live in alder tree root nodules ; single-celled algae inside reef-building corals ; and bacterial endosymbionts that provide essential nutrients to about 10 % -- 15 % of insects . EOS

EOS
SOS examples of this include ectoparasites such as lice , commensal ectosymbionts such as the barnacles that attach themselves to the jaw of baleen whales , and UNK ectosymbionts such as cleaner fish . EOS
SOS examples of this include ectoparasites such as lice , commensal ectosymbionts such as the barnacles that attach themselves to the jaw of baleen whales , and UNK ectosymbionts such as cleaner fish . EOS
SOS ectosymbiosis , also referred to as UNK , is any symbiotic relationship in which the UNK lives on the body surface of the host , including the inner surface of the digestive tract or the ducts of UNK glands . EOS
SOS mutualism or interspecies reciprocal altruism is a relationship between individuals of different species where both individuals benefit . EOS
SOS in general , only lifelong interactions involving close physical and biochemical contact can properly be considered symbiotic . EOS
SOS a large percentage of herbivores have mutualistic gut flora that help them digest plant matter , which is more difficult to digest than animal prey . EOS
SOS coral reefs are the result of mutualisms between coral organisms and various types of algae that live inside them . EOS
SOS most land plants and land ecosystems rely on mutualisms between the plants , which fix carbon from the air , and UNK fungi , which help in extracting water and minerals from the ground . EOS
SOS most land plants and land ecosystems rely on mutualisms between the plants , which fix carbon from the air , and UNK fungi , which help in extracting water and minerals from the ground . EOS
SOS an example of mutual symbiosis is the relationship between the UNK clownfish that dwell among the tentacles of UNK sea anemones . EOS
SOS a special mucus on the clownfish protects it from the stinging tentacles . EOS
SOS an example of mutual symbiosis is the relationship between the UNK clownfish that dwell among the tentacles of UNK sea anemones . EOS
SOS a further example is the UNK fish , which sometimes lives together with a shrimp . EOS
SOS in case of danger the UNK fish touches the shrimp with its tail to warn it . EOS
SOS another non-obligate symbiosis is known from UNK UNK and hermit crabs that live in a close relationship . EOS
SOS these worms were discovered in the late 1980s at the hydrothermal vents near the galapagos islands and have since been found at deep-sea hydrothermal vents and cold seeps in all of the world 's oceans . EOS
SOS the worm has no digestive tract and is wholly reliant on its internal symbionts for nutrition . EOS
SOS these worms were discovered in the late 1980s at the hydrothermal vents near the galapagos islands and have since been found at deep-sea hydrothermal vents and cold seeps in all of the world 's oceans . EOS
SOS during mutualistic UNK , the host cell lacks some of the nutrients , which are provided by the endosymbiont . EOS
SOS as a result , the host favors endosymbiont 's growth processes within itself by producing some specialized cells . EOS
SOS these cells affect the genetic composition of the host in order to regulate the increasing population of the endosymbionts and ensuring that these genetic changes are passed onto the offspring via vertical transmission -lrb- heredity -rrb- . EOS
SOS adaptation of the endosymbiont to the host 's lifestyle leads to many changes in the endosymbiont -- the foremost being drastic reduction in its genome size . EOS
SOS this UNK of the endosymbiotic bacteria to reinstate its wild type phenotype via a recombination process is called as muller 's ratchet phenomenon . EOS
SOS this could have been due to lack of selection mechanisms prevailing in the rich environment of the host . EOS
SOS the word derives from the medieval latin word , formed from UNK - and UNK , meaning " sharing a table " . EOS
SOS UNK describes a relationship between two living organisms where one benefits and the other is not significantly harmed or helped . EOS
SOS commensal relationships may involve one organism using another for transportation -lrb- UNK -rrb- or for housing -lrb- UNK -rrb- , or it may also involve one organism using something another created , after its death -lrb- UNK -rrb- . EOS
SOS commensal relationships may involve one organism using another for transportation -lrb- UNK -rrb- or for housing -lrb- UNK -rrb- , or it may also involve one organism using something another created , after its death -lrb- UNK -rrb- . EOS
SOS in addition , parasites may be UNK , which is to say they kill their host , or biotrophic , meaning they rely on their host 's surviving . EOS
SOS in addition , parasites may be UNK , which is to say they kill their host , or biotrophic , meaning they rely on their host 's surviving . EOS
SOS depending on the definition used , as many as half of all animals have at least one parasitic phase in their life cycles , and it is also frequent in plants and fungi . EOS
SOS an example of a biotrophic relationship would be a UNK feeding on the blood of its host . EOS
SOS amensalism is the type of relationship that exists where one species is UNK or completely UNK and one is unaffected . EOS
SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- there are two types of amensalism , competition and antibiosis . EOS
SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- there are two types of amensalism , competition and antibiosis . EOS
SOS -lsb- citation needed -rsb- an example of antibiosis is UNK UNK -lrb- black walnut -rrb- , secreting UNK , a substance which destroys many UNK plants within its root zone . EOS
SOS amensalism is often used to describe strongly asymmetrical competitive interactions , such as has been observed between the spanish ibex and weevils of the genus UNK which feed upon the same type of shrub . EOS
SOS amensalism is often used to describe strongly asymmetrical competitive interactions , such as has been observed between the spanish ibex and weevils of the genus UNK which feed upon the same type of shrub . EOS
SOS UNK is a rare type of symbiosis in which the interaction between species is detrimental to both organisms involved . EOS
SOS because of this , evolution selects against UNK and it is uncommon in nature . EOS
SOS species of bees who die after stinging their prey inflict pain on themselves -lrb- albeit to protect the hive -rrb- as well as on the victim . EOS
SOS in fact , the evolution of all eukaryotes -lrb- plants , animals , fungi , and protists -rrb- is believed under the endosymbiotic theory to have resulted from a symbiosis between various sorts of bacteria . EOS
SOS in fact , the evolution of all eukaryotes -lrb- plants , animals , fungi , and protists -rrb- is believed under the endosymbiotic theory to have resulted from a symbiosis between various sorts of bacteria . EOS
SOS the biologist lynn margulis , famous for her work on endosymbiosis , contends that symbiosis is a major driving force behind evolution . EOS
SOS according to margulis and UNK sagan , " life did not take over the globe by combat , but by networking . " EOS
SOS symbiosis played a major role in the UNK of flowering plants and the animals that UNK them . EOS
SOS some groups of plants developed nectar and large sticky pollen , while insects evolved more specialized morphologies to access and collect these rich food sources . EOS
SOS in some taxa of plants and insects the relationship has become dependent , where the plant species can only be pollinated by one species of insect . EOS
SOS the canadian armed forces -lrb- caf ; french : forces armes canadiennes , fac -rrb- , or canadian forces -lrb- cf -rrb- -lrb- french : les forces canadiennes , fc -rrb- , is the unified armed force of canada , as constituted by the national defence act , which states : " the canadian forces are the armed forces of her majesty raised by canada and consist of one service called the canadian armed forces . " EOS

SOS the canadian armed forces -lrb- caf ; french : forces armes canadiennes , fac -rrb- , or canadian forces -lrb- cf -rrb- -lrb- french : les forces canadiennes , fc -rrb- , is the unified armed force of canada , as constituted by the national defence act , which states : " the canadian forces are the armed forces of her majesty raised by canada and consist of one service called the canadian armed forces . " EOS
SOS under the national defence act , the canadian armed forces are an entity separate and distinct from the department of national defence -lrb- the federal government department responsible for administration and formation of defence policy -rrb- , which also exists as the civilian support system for the forces . EOS

SOS canadian defence policy today is based on the canada first defence strategy , introduced in 2008 . EOS
SOS canadian defence policy today is based on the canada first defence strategy , introduced in 2008 . EOS
SOS based on that strategy , the canadian military is oriented and being equipped to carry out six core missions within canada , in north america and globally . EOS

SOS consistent with the missions and priorities outlined above , the canadian armed forces also contribute to the conduct of canadian defence diplomacy through a range of activities , including the deployment of canadian defence attachs , participation in bilateral and multilateral military forums -lrb- e.g . the system of cooperation among the american air forces -rrb- , ship and aircraft visits , military training and cooperation , and other such outreach and relationship-building efforts . SOS prior to confederation in 1867 , residents of the colonies in what is now canada served as regular members of french and british forces and in local militia groups . EOS
SOS prior to confederation in 1867 , residents of the colonies in what is now canada served as regular members of french and british forces and in local militia groups . EOS
SOS the latter aided in the defence of their respective territories against attacks by other european powers , aboriginal peoples , and later american forces during the american revolutionary war and war of 1812 , as well as in the fenian raids , red river rebellion , and north-west rebellion . EOS
SOS consequently , the lineages of some canadian army units stretch back to the early 19th century , when militia units were formed to assist in the defence of british north america against invasion by the united states . EOS
SOS the responsibility for military command remained with the british crown-in-council , with a commander-in-chief for north america stationed at halifax until the final withdrawal of british army and royal navy units from that city in 1906 . EOS
SOS the responsibility for military command remained with the british crown-in-council , with a commander-in-chief for north america stationed at halifax until the final withdrawal of british army and royal navy units from that city in 1906 . EOS
SOS the responsibility for military command remained with the british crown-in-council , with a commander-in-chief for north america stationed at halifax until the final withdrawal of british army and royal navy units from that city in 1906 . EOS
SOS these forces were organised under the department of militia and defence , and split into the permanent and UNK active militias -- frequently shortened to simply the militia . EOS
SOS by 1923 , the department was merged into the department of national defence , but land forces in canada were not referred to as the canadian army until november 1940 . EOS
SOS the first overseas deployment of canadian military forces occurred during the second boer war , when several units were raised to serve under british command . EOS
SOS the first overseas deployment of canadian military forces occurred during the second boer war , when several units were raised to serve under british command . EOS

SOS since 1947 , canadian military units have participated in more than 200 operations worldwide , and completed 72 international operations . EOS
SOS since 1947 , canadian military units have participated in more than 200 operations worldwide , and completed 72 international operations . EOS
SOS canadian soldiers , sailors , and aviators came to be considered world-class professionals through conspicuous service during these conflicts and the country 's integral participation in nato during the cold war , first gulf war , kosovo war , and in united nations peacekeeping operations , such as the suez crisis , golan heights , cyprus , croatia , bosnia , afghanistan , and libya . EOS

SOS at the end of the second world war , canada possessed the fourth-largest air force and fifth-largest naval surface fleet in the world , as well as the largest volunteer army ever fielded . EOS
SOS originally , canada was thought to have had the third-largest navy in the world , but with the fall of the soviet union , new data based on japanese and soviet sources found that to be incorrect . EOS
SOS the current iteration of the canadian armed forces dates from 1 february 1968 , when the royal canadian navy , canadian army , and royal canadian air force were merged into a unified structure and superseded by elemental commands . EOS

SOS in the 1950s , the recruitment of women was open to roles in medicine , communication , logistics , and administration . EOS
SOS the roles of women in the caf began to expand in 1971 , after the department reviewed the recommendations of the royal commission on the status of women , at which time it lifted the ceiling of 1,500 women personnel , and gradually expanded employment opportunities into the non-traditional areas -- vehicle drivers and mechanics , aircraft mechanics , UNK controllers , military police , and firefighters . EOS
SOS the roles of women in the caf began to expand in 1971 , after the department reviewed the recommendations of the royal commission on the status of women , at which time it lifted the ceiling of 1,500 women personnel , and gradually expanded employment opportunities into the non-traditional areas -- vehicle drivers and mechanics , aircraft mechanics , UNK controllers , military police , and firefighters . EOS
SOS as a result of these reviews , the department changed its policies to permit women to serve at sea in replenishment ships and in a diving tender , with the army service battalions , in military police UNK and field ambulance units , and in most air squadrons . EOS
SOS the department further reviewed personnel policies in 1978 and 1985 , after parliament passed the canadian human rights act and the canadian charter of rights and freedoms . EOS
SOS in 1987 , occupations and units with the primary role of preparing for direct involvement in combat on the ground or at sea were still closed to women : infantry , armoured corps , field artillery , air-defence artillery , signals , field engineers , and naval operations . EOS

SOS throughout the 1990s , the introduction of women into the combat arms increased the potential recruiting pool by about 100 percent . EOS
SOS women were fully integrated in all occupations and roles by the government of jean UNK , and by 8 march 2000 , even allowed to serve on submarines . EOS
SOS all equipment must be suitable for a mixed-gender force . EOS
SOS combat helmets , UNK , combat boots , and flak jackets are designed to ensure women have the same level of protection and comfort as their male colleagues . EOS

SOS the canadian constitution determines that the commander-in-chief of the canadian armed forces is the country 's sovereign , who , since 1904 , has authorized his or her viceroy , the governor general , to exercise the duties ascribed to the post of commander-in-chief and to hold the associated title since 1905 . SOS the armed forces ' UNK personnel are divided into a hierarchy of numerous ranks of officers and non-commissioned members . EOS

SOS the armed forces council generally operates from national defence headquarters -lrb- ndhq -rrb- in ottawa , ontario . EOS
SOS on the armed forces council sit the heads of canadian joint operations command and canadian special operations forces command , the vice chief of the defence staff , and the heads of the royal canadian navy , the canadian army , the royal canadian air force and other key level 1 organizations . SOS the commander of 1 canadian air division and canadian UNK region , based in winnipeg , is responsible for the operational command and control of air force activities throughout canada and worldwide . EOS
SOS 1 canadian air division operations are carried out through eleven wings located across canada . EOS
SOS wings represent the grouping of various squadrons , both operational and support , under a single tactical commander reporting to the operational commander and vary in size from several hundred personnel to several thousand . EOS

SOS in the 12th century the practice of appointing UNK from outside rome as cardinals began , with each of them assigned a church in rome as his titular church or linked with one of the suburbicarian dioceses , while still being incardinated in a diocese other than that of rome . EOS

SOS cardinals have in canon law a " privilege of forum " -lrb- i.e . , exemption from being judged by ecclesiastical tribunals of ordinary rank -rrb- : only the pope is competent to judge them in matters subject to ecclesiastical jurisdiction -lrb- cases that refer to matters that are spiritual or linked with the spiritual , or with regard to infringement of ecclesiastical laws and whatever contains an element of sin , where culpability must be determined and the appropriate ecclesiastical penalty imposed -rrb- . SOS proto-iranian thus dates to some time after proto-indo-iranian break-up , or the early second millennium bce , as the old iranian languages began to break off and evolve separately as the various iranian tribes migrated and settled in vast areas of southeastern europe , the iranian plateau , and central asia . EOS
SOS the multitude of middle iranian languages and peoples indicate that great linguistic diversity must have existed among the ancient speakers of iranian languages . EOS

SOS later inscriptions are comparatively brief , and typically simply copies of words and phrases from earlier ones , often with grammatical errors , which suggests that by the 4th century bc the transition from old persian to middle persian was already far advanced , but efforts were still being made to retain an " old " quality for official proclamations . EOS

SOS following this lead , the bauhaus school , founded in weimar , germany in 1919 , redefined the architectural bounds prior set throughout history , viewing the creation of a building as the ultimate synthesis -- the apex -- of art , craft , and technology . EOS
SOS when modern architecture was first practiced , it was an avant-garde movement with moral , philosophical , and aesthetic underpinnings . EOS
SOS immediately after world war i , pioneering modernist architects sought to develop a completely new style appropriate for a new post-war social and economic order , focused on meeting the needs of the middle and working classes . EOS

SOS robert venturi famously defined postmodern architecture as a " decorated shed " -lrb- an ordinary building which is functionally designed inside and embellished on the outside -rrb- , and upheld it against modernist and brutalist " ducks " -lrb- buildings with unnecessarily expressive tectonic forms -rrb- . SOS robert venturi famously defined postmodern architecture as a " decorated shed " -lrb- an ordinary building which is functionally designed inside and embellished on the outside -rrb- , and upheld it against modernist and brutalist " ducks " -lrb- buildings with unnecessarily expressive tectonic forms -rrb- . SOS a large structure can no longer be the design of one person but must be the work of many . EOS
SOS modernism and postmodernism have been criticised by some members of the architectural profession who feel that successful architecture is not a personal , philosophical , or aesthetic pursuit by individualists ; rather it has to consider everyday needs of people and use technology to create liveable environments , with the design process being informed by studies of behavioral , environmental , and social sciences . SOS the human development index -lrb- hdi -rrb- is a composite statistic of life expectancy , education , and income per capita indicators , which are used to rank countries into four tiers of human development . EOS
SOS a country scores higher hdi when the life expectancy at birth is longer , the education period is longer , and the income per capita is higher . EOS
SOS the hdi was developed by the pakistani economist mahbub ul haq , often framed in terms of whether people are able to " be " and " do " desirable things in their life , and was published by the united nations development programme . EOS

SOS the human development index has been criticized on a number of grounds including alleged ideological biases towards egalitarianism and so-called " western models of development " , failure to include any ecological considerations , lack of consideration of technological development or contributions to the human civilization , focusing exclusively on national performance and ranking , lack of attention to development from a global perspective , measurement error of the underlying statistics , and on the undp 's changes in formula which can lead to severe misclassification in the categorisation of ` low ' , ` medium ' , ` high ' or ` very high ' human development countries . SOS the soviet economic and political system collapsed , leading to the end of communism in the satellite countries in 1989 , and the dissolution of the soviet union itself in 1991 . EOS
SOS as a consequence , europe 's integration deepened , the continent became UNK , and the european union expanded to subsequently include many of the formerly communist european countries -- romania and bulgaria -lrb- 2007 -rrb- and croatia -lrb- 2013 -rrb- . EOS
SOS the most widely spoken family of languages in southern europe are the romance languages , the heirs of latin , which have spread from the italian peninsula , and are emblematic of southwestern europe . EOS
SOS by far the most common romance languages in southern europe are : italian , which is spoken by over 50 million people in italy , san marino , and the vatican ; and spanish , which is spoken by over 40 million people in spain and gibraltar . EOS
SOS other common romance languages include : romanian , which is spoken in romania and moldova ; portuguese , which is spoken in portugal ; catalan , which is spoken in eastern spain ; and galician , which is spoken in northwestern spain . EOS

SOS the predominant religion is southern europe is christianity . EOS
SOS christianity spread throughout southern europe during the roman empire , and christianity was adopted as the official religion of the roman empire in the year 380 ad . EOS
SOS christians in the western half of southern europe -- e.g . , portugal , spain , italy -- are generally roman catholic . EOS
SOS christians in the eastern half of southern europe -- e.g . , greece , macedonia -- are generally greek orthodox . EOS

SOS bbc television is a service of the british broadcasting corporation . EOS
SOS the corporation , which has operated in the united kingdom under the terms of a royal charter since 1927 , has produced television programmes from its own since 1932 , although the start of its regular service of television broadcasts is dated to 2 november 1936 . EOS
SOS the corporation , which has operated in the united kingdom under the terms of a royal charter since 1927 , has produced television programmes from its own since 1932 , although the start of its regular service of television broadcasts is dated to 2 november 1936 . EOS
SOS the domestic tv bbc television channels are broadcast without any commercial advertising and collectively they account for more than 30 % of all uk viewing . EOS
SOS as well as being a broadcaster , the corporation also produces a large number of its own programmes in-house , thereby ranking as one of the world 's largest television production companies . EOS
SOS baird television ltd. made britain 's first television broadcast , on 30 september 1929 from its studio in long acre , london , via the bbc 's london transmitter , using the electromechanical system pioneered by john logie baird . EOS

SOS baird television ltd. made britain 's first television broadcast , on 30 september 1929 from its studio in long acre , london , via the bbc 's london transmitter , using the electromechanical system pioneered by john logie baird . EOS
SOS baird broadcasts via the bbc continued until june 1932 . EOS
SOS the bbc began its own regular television programming from the basement of broadcasting house , london , on 22 august 1932 . EOS
SOS the studio moved to larger quarters in 16 portland place , london , in february 1934 , and continued broadcasting the 30-line images , carried by telephone line to the medium wave transmitter at brookmans park , until 11 september 1935 , by which time advances in all-electronic television systems made the electromechanical broadcasts obsolete . SOS after a series of test transmissions and special broadcasts that began in august , regular bbc television broadcasts officially resumed on 1 october 1936 , from a converted wing of alexandra palace in london , which housed two studios , various scenery stores , make-up areas , dressing rooms , offices , and the transmitter itself , now broadcasting on the vhf band . EOS

EOS
SOS bbc television initially used two systems , on alternate weeks : the 240-line baird intermediate film system and the 405-line marconi-emi system , each making the bbc the world 's first regular high-definition television service , broadcasting monday to saturday from 15:00 to 16:00 and 21:00 to 22:00 . EOS

SOS mechanically scanned , 30-line television broadcasts by john logie baird began in 1929 , using the bbc transmitter in london , and by 1930 a regular schedule of programmes was transmitted from the bbc antenna in brookmans park . EOS
SOS television production was switched from baird 's company to what is now known as bbc one on 2 august 1932 , and continued until september 1935 . EOS
SOS the first programme broadcast -- and thus the first ever , on a dedicated tv channel -- was " opening of the bbc television service " at 15:00 . EOS
SOS the first major outside broadcast was the coronation of king george vi and queen elizabeth in may 1937 . EOS
SOS the service was reaching an estimated 25,000 -- 40,000 homes before the outbreak of world war ii which caused the service to be suspended in september 1939 . EOS
SOS on 1 september 1939 , two days before britain declared war on germany , the station was taken off air with little warning ; the government was concerned that the vhf transmissions would act as a beacon to enemy aircraft homing in on london . EOS
SOS also , many of the television service 's technical staff and engineers would be needed for the war effort , in particular on the radar programme . EOS
SOS the last programme transmitted was a mickey mouse cartoon , mickey 's gala premier -lrb- 1933 -rrb- , which was followed by test transmissions ; this account refuted the popular memory according to which broadcasting was suspended before the end of the cartoon . EOS
SOS according to figures from britain 's radio manufacturers association , UNK television sets had been manufactured from 1936 to september 1939 , when production was halted by the war . EOS

SOS the mickey mouse cartoon of 1939 was repeated twenty minutes later . EOS

SOS plymouth -lrb- i / plm / -rrb- is a city on the south coast of devon , england , about 37 miles -lrb- 60 km -rrb- south-west of exeter and 190 miles -lrb- 310 km -rrb- west-south-west of london , between the mouths of the rivers plym to the east and tamar to the west where they join plymouth sound to form the boundary with cornwall . EOS
SOS plymouth 's early history extends to the bronze age , when a first settlement emerged at mount batten . EOS
SOS this settlement continued as a trading post for the roman empire , until it was surpassed by the more prosperous village of sutton , now called plymouth . EOS
SOS in 1620 , the pilgrim fathers departed plymouth for the new world and established plymouth colony -- the second english settlement in what is now the united states of america . EOS
SOS during the english civil war the town was held by the parliamentarians and was besieged between 1642 and 1646 . EOS
SOS in 1620 , the pilgrim fathers departed plymouth for the new world and established plymouth colony -- the second english settlement in what is now the united states of america . EOS
SOS throughout the industrial revolution , plymouth grew as a commercial shipping port , handling imports and passengers from the americas , and exporting local minerals -lrb- tin , copper , lime , china clay and arsenic -rrb- while the neighbouring town of devonport became a strategic royal naval shipbuilding and dockyard town . EOS
SOS the combined town took the name of plymouth which , in 1928 , achieved city status . EOS
SOS the city 's naval importance later led to its targeting and partial destruction during world war ii , an act known as the plymouth blitz . EOS
SOS after the war the city centre was completely rebuilt and subsequent expansion led to the incorporation of plympton and plymstock along with other outlying suburbs in 1967 . EOS
SOS in 1914 three neighbouring independent towns , UNK . , the county borough of plymouth , the county borough of devonport , and the urban district of east stonehouse were merged to form a single county borough . EOS
SOS the city is home to UNK -lrb- mid-2014 est . -rrb- people , making it the 30th most populous built-up area in the united kingdom . EOS
SOS it is governed locally by plymouth city council and is represented nationally by three mps . EOS
SOS plymouth 's economy remains strongly influenced by shipbuilding and seafaring including ferry links to brittany -lrb- roscoff and st malo -rrb- and spain -lrb- santander -rrb- , but has tended toward a service-based economy since the 1990s . EOS
SOS it has the largest operational naval base in western europe -- hmnb devonport and is home to plymouth university . EOS
SOS an unidentified settlement named ` UNK ostia ' -lrb- UNK of the tamar -rrb- is listed in ptolemy 's geographia and is presumed to be located in the area of the modern city . EOS
SOS upper palaeolithic deposits , including bones of homo sapiens , have been found in local caves , and artefacts dating from the bronze age to the middle iron age have been found at mount batten showing that it was one of the main trading ports of the country at that time . EOS

SOS the settlement of plympton , further up the river plym than the current plymouth , was also an early trading port , but the river UNK up in the early 11th century and forced the mariners and merchants to settle at the current day barbican near the river mouth . EOS
SOS at the time this village was called sutton , meaning south town in old english . EOS

SOS the name plymouth first officially replaced sutton in a charter of king henry vi in 1440 . EOS

SOS during the hundred years ' war a french attack -lrb- 1340 -rrb- burned a manor house and took some prisoners , but failed to get into the town . EOS
SOS in 1403 the town was burned by breton raiders . EOS
SOS this location was further strengthened by the building of a fort -lrb- later known as drake 's fort -rrb- in 1596 , which itself went on to provide the site for the citadel , established in the UNK -lrb- see below -rrb- . EOS
SOS the castle served to protect sutton pool , which is where the fleet was based in plymouth prior to the establishment of plymouth dockyard . EOS
SOS in 1512 an act of parliament was passed for further UNK plymouth , and a series of fortifications were then built , including defensive walls at the entrance to sutton pool -lrb- across which a chain would be extended in time of danger -rrb- . EOS

SOS before the latter half of the 18th century , grain , timber and then coal were plymouth 's main imports . EOS
SOS during this time the real source of wealth was from the neighbouring town of plymouth dock -lrb- renamed in 1824 to devonport -rrb- and the major employer in the entire region was the dockyard . EOS

SOS the 1971 local government white paper proposed abolishing county boroughs , which would have left plymouth , a town of 250,000 people , being administered from a council based at the smaller exeter , on the other side of the county . EOS
SOS the 1971 local government white paper proposed abolishing county boroughs , which would have left plymouth , a town of 250,000 people , being administered from a council based at the smaller exeter , on the other side of the county . EOS
SOS this led to plymouth lobbying for the creation of a UNK county , to include plymouth , UNK , UNK , and the rural hinterland . EOS
SOS the campaign was not successful , and plymouth ceased to be a county borough on 1 april 1974 with responsibility for education , social services , highways and libraries transferred to devon county council . EOS
SOS all powers returned when the city become a unitary authority on 1 april 1998 under recommendations of the UNK commission . EOS

SOS the bulk of the city is built upon upper devonian slates and shales and the headlands at the entrance to plymouth sound are formed of lower devonian slates , which can withstand the power of the sea . EOS

SOS rocks brought down the tamar from dartmoor include ores containing tin , copper , tungsten , lead and other minerals . EOS

SOS along with the rest of south west england , plymouth has a temperate oceanic climate -lrb- kppen cfb -rrb- which is generally wetter and milder than the rest of england . EOS
SOS the annual mean temperature is approximately 11 c -lrb- 52 f -rrb- . EOS
SOS as a result of this summer highs are lower than its southerly latitude should warrant , but as a contrast the coldest month of february has mean minimum temperatures as mild as between 3 and 4 c -lrb- 37 and 39 f -rrb- . EOS
SOS snow is rare , not usually UNK to more than a few UNK , but there have been UNK , namely the european winter storms of 2009-10 which , in early january , covered plymouth in at least 1 inch -lrb- 2.5 cm -rrb- of snow ; more on higher ground . EOS
SOS july and august are the warmest months with mean daily maxima over 19 c -lrb- 66 f -rrb- . EOS
SOS rainfall tends to be associated with atlantic depressions or with convection . EOS
SOS the atlantic depressions are more vigorous in autumn and winter and most of the rain which falls in those seasons in the south-west is from this source . EOS
SOS november to march have the highest mean wind speeds , with june to august having the lightest winds . EOS
SOS coastal areas have average annual sunshine totals over 1,600 hours . EOS
SOS south west england has a favoured location when the azores high pressure area extends UNK towards the uk , particularly in summer . EOS
